physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Physical examination notable for peripheral wasting and marked abdominal distension due to ascites. Chest radiograph revealed bilateral pleural effusions but no parenchymal disease.
Culture of fluid obtained from repeated paracentesis remained positive for C. immitis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No clinical improvement with amphotericin B treatment; treatment switched to oral fluconazole on July 14, 1993.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cultures of peritoneal biopsy and fluid specimens obtained were positive for C. immitis.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual clinical improvement noted after switching to fluconazole.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A cocciodioidin skin test was negative.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Five years later, the patient was well without evidence of recurrent disease.
